fields.description: I'm looking for details on the REST API. Specifically if there's a possibility to get a list of associated commits with a Pull Request. From looking through response on a pull request query, associated commits aren't included. They are included on the web UI though to the user.

fields.description:
I'm planning to store a lot of Powershell DSC scripts and snipets, and use it as a tool to train my team on writing DSC resources and modules.

Is it possible to get Powershell added to 'Syntax mode'?
fields.summary: Add Powershell Support to Editor

fields.description:
When setting up more complex pipelines, I think it is useful to add some comments so it is possible to document what is happening. However, when putting comments inside of the build execution unit they get ignored and do not show up in the pipeline's result log.

E.g, a script that requires SSH access to servers (taken from [the Pipelines docs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/access-remote-hosts-via-ssh-847452940.html#AccessremotehostsviaSSH-Step5:Tieeverythingtogetherinyourbitbucket-pipelines.ymlfile]:

{code}
#!yml

- step:
    script:
        - # Set up SSH so we can access bitbucket
        - mkdir -p ~/.ssh
        - cat my_known_hosts >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts
        - (umask  077 ; echo $MY_SSH_KEY | base64 --decode > ~/.ssh/id_rsa)
        # Clone some repo we need
        - git clone git @bitbucket.org:<account_name>/<repo_name>.git
        ## Do stuff with the repo we need ##
        - cd repo_name
        - do stuff
{code}

The log will show something like:

{code}
> Build setup
> mkdir -p ~/.ssh
> cat my_known_hosts >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts
> (umask  077 ; echo $MY_SSH_KEY | base64 --decode > ~/.ssh/id_rsa)
> git clone git @bitbucket.org:<account_name>/<repo_name>.git
> cd repo_name
> do stuff
{code}

Completely ignoring the (IMO useful) comments. The only way to display "comments" inside the logs is by using e.g an echo command, like {{echo Do stuff with the repo we need}}.

It would be handy to have some way to document what is being done inside the log, e.g by printing commented commands. Some way to add some extra info here, like making the comments appear differently than commands in the logs or the option to group commands, would make this feature even better.
fields.summary: Show comments / grouping commands in Bitbucket Pipelines logs

fields.description: Placeholder for notification bug. Functionality works, we just do not display whether or not someone checked a specific notification under the repository "watch" icon.
fields.summary: Notification settings do not appear to save in UI (Repo notification settings)

fields.description:
{code}
#!

>git pull

remote: Counting objects: 2732, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (1942/1942), done.
Connection to bitbucket.org closed by remote host.13.00 KiB/s
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
fatal: early EOF
fatal: index-pack failed
{code}

please help, can't continue to work on the project
fields.summary: Connection to bitbucket.org closed by remote host

fields.description:
When a user creates a pull request we run a manual SonarQube job to provide automated feedback inside the PullRequest.

See:\\
https://github.com/mibexsoftware/sonar-bitbucket-plugin

We could automate this using Jenkins and a WebHook but it would be nicer if can run this sonar step inside a (standard) pipeline. This can be 'easily' achieved if the pipeline is also triggered when a pull request is created.
fields.summary: Trigger Pipeline on Pull Request

fields.description:
Pull requests offer valuable insight into the bigger picture around a commit -- moving from small atomic changes to the context of related changes and how they fit together.

When viewing a commit in the BitBucket UI, please offer a link to PR(s) containing that commit.  This would be helpful navigation for open PRs, but is particularly valuable for CLOSED pull requests, where a flow might look like this:

# Identify an issue or regression.
# Using {{git bisest}} or {{git blame}}, identify the commit where the issue was introduced
# View the commit
# Next logical move is to step up to the PR, but there's currently no easy way to do this.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Link from commit to PR

Currently an NPM build with a number of dependencies produces a lot of output and I see the message:

{code}
................
 Please download the raw log to see the full output of this command. 

{code}

This prevents me from being able to tell whether the build has hung. With limited build minutes, this is a concern for me.
fields.summary: pipelines build log should show last n lines

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If User A approved a PR before the PR is updated, it will not show User A approved activity after the PR is updated
 (With _Reset approvals when source branch is modified_ checked on branch permission)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Check _Reset approvals when source branch is modified_ in *Repository Settings>Branch permission*
 # Create a new PR
 # Click *Approve*
 # Update the PR to reset approvals
 # Navigate back to the PR
 # Click *Approve*
 # Navigate to _Overview_ page

h3. Expected Results

The approved activity will be show in _Recent Activities_
h3. Actual Results

The approved activity doesn't show in _Recent Activities_
h3. Notes

The approve/disapprove activities will continue show after user click disapprove and approve again.
fields.summary: Recent Activities(Overview) doesn't show approved activity after PR is updated

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With _Reset approvals when source branch is modified_ checked on branch permission, each PR update resets PR approvals. This removes the previous approvals from the activity feed as well.

h3. Solution suggested
It will be best that the previous approved action be kept in the activity log for references.
fields.summary: Show previous approvals in PR activity feed

fields.description: How can I solve this thank you.
fields.summary: I've got "You do not have access to this repository."

fields.description:
I'd like to suggest an option for a "protected" repository access level, what it means is that the source code would be public, but branches, commits, code comments etc would be private.\\
Only the source code and ability to clone would be public.\\
Currently if I want to achieve this, I need to start a new public repository with the current code and do this again if the original repo changed, which is a pain.\\
The use case for this would be, if you want to show others your code, but don't want to show more personal commit messages or comments or code comments (that are on the site), those can be less formal and often irrelevant to someone from the outside.
fields.summary: Add new access level permission for a mixed mode version of public/private.

fields.description: When receiving an email notification for a direct message, there is a link to: https://bitbucket.org/account/notifications/ named "View inbox" (http://pasteboard.co/m2Jr6g1mX.png). This link redirects to: https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview which does not contain any information on the direct message inbox (http://pasteboard.co/m39hj8ni2.png).

* {{--header "Authorization: Bearer ..."}} with {{repository}} scope

fields.description: As a developer I would like to be able to set the Bitbucket Pipelines build timeout. We're using submodule which means that sometime people push commits containing references to SHAs in other projects that haven't yet been pushed, causing the build to hang. This causes 150 build minutes to be wasted when a normal build for us is 5-10 minutes. It would be great if I could set the timeout myself, thereby lowering it by a lot and catching these hung builds much earlier.
fields.summary: Configurable timeout or hang detection in Pipelines to avoid wasting build minutes

fields.description:
The build status api requires a url parameter.

Currently this URL must be a 'valid' URL. We have a jenkins build server on premise that we access directly with ip:port , bitbucket rejects this.

So currently we just have to throw some random url that doesn't have anything to do with our build. It would be better if we didn't need a url at all, and even better if we can put in our local server ip and port.
fields.summary: Statuses/build API - allow local server url

fields.description:
###Problem Definition

* Users have high numbers of files in LFS storage, which is time consuming when trying to remove them individually, especially in cases where they need to retain a number of files, while removing the rest.

###Suggestion

* To provide a function to bulk delete LFS files based on selection in the Bitbucket UI.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk delete LFS files in UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If signing up via team invitation mail, we can't login Bitbucket Cloud with the password I set then.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to add a person who doesn't have any BB account and Atlassian Account to a Team
# Invitation mail is sent to the person
# The person signs up via the mail
# The person logs out from BB and id.atlassian.com
# The person tries to login BB with the password which the person set in the signup process

h3. Expected Results
The person should signup correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The person couldn't login with the password.

h3. Workaround
Reset the password via "Forgot your password?" link and try to login with the new password.
fields.summary: If signing up via team invitation mail, we can't login Bitbucket Cloud with the password I set then

fields.description:
Please add functionality to allow a global admin user to arrange SSH keys for every user that is granted access to the repositories.

For example, as an individual user I can add my SSH keys at page: https://bitbucket.org/account/user/kallon/ssh-keys/

But we'd like to add per-user (staff members) SSH keys through a team/group orientated admin settings page like at: https://bitbucket.org/account/user/invigorgroup/ssh-keys/

I am disappointed that an Admin user cannot administer the keys for everyone accessing the repositories.

For example, if we have a policy that we must reset all SSH keys every 6 months, there is no way to enforce that.\\
I could remove the user from having access to the repos until they change their keys, but how would I know if they have actually changed the key?\\
There could be a notification I can configure that will guarantee specific notification that a user's key has been removed and replaced with a different one.

Cheers
fields.summary: Allow SSH key management at the global/team level instead of by each user individually

fields.description: Most software companies these days use jenkins and Bamboo not only for running the tests, but also to ensure the code quality. For this purpose, you can add to your maven project for instance a cobertura plugin (for measuring the test coverage). Although the pipelines seem to be an amazing idea that makes everybody's life much easier, I still wouldn't recommend it to anyone until pipelines can do the same things jenkins does for the java projects.
fields.summary: Publish/link to reports and artifacts generated during the build

fields.description:
_Related issue: BCLOUD-10466_

----
Hi Bitbucket,

I'm going straight to the issue:

People need approval from repository owner to join, that's fine. But they should be free to leave.

One easy-and-acceptable solution should be letting the member leave after automatic-notification to repo owner for some time, like 3 days, 5 days, 1 week... Or just no delay time at all.

If someone wants to leave, they leave. Why keep them in member list if they don't want to contribute/cooperate anymore?

Bitbucket, please be more flexible, we code, we're not the code.

Thank you,

When a user goes to the Snippets dropdown on top of the page, all links on the 'Recently Viewed' and 'Recently Updated' will point to the page the user is currently on (E.g: if the user is on a repo overview page, all snippets link from the dropdown will point to the repo overview page)

fields.description:
If you have a commit on a branch that resolves an issue using the "fixes #xxx" format in the commit message, the issue gets correctly resolved. But if someone reopens the issue afterwards and someone else merges the branch into another one (e.g. by pull request) the Issue gets fixed again, by the same commit, even though nothing changed between reopening and resolving.

I looked if there exists another issue like this one, didn't find anything.

Easy steps to reproduce:

# Create branch "branch-x"
# Create issue xxx
# Create commit on branch-x with commit message "fixes #xxx"
# Create pull request for branch-x to master
# Reopen issue xxx
# Merge pull request.

Result: issue xxx is resolved.

Expected result: A single commit can't resolve the issue twice.
fields.summary: When merging don't re-resolve issues that were reopened

fields.description:
A lot of us have a branch per environment (development, stage, production).

Presently, the environment variables are set for the complete repository (Repository variables) and for the team or developer account (Team and individual account variables).

Team or individual account variables can be overridden by repository variables.

In the same order of ideas, we should consider to add the Branch variables level to offer a different environment variable values per branch (or environment).

Team or individual account variables can be overridden by repository variables, and repository variables can be overridden by branch variables.

Team/Individual > Repository > Branch.

Eg 1: Branch 1

* Team/Individual: SECRET=FOO
* Repository: SECRET=BAR
* Branch: SECRET=BAZ
* *RESULT*: SECRET=BAZ

Eg 2: Branch 2

* Team/Individual: SECRET=FOO
* Repository: SECRET=BAR
* Branch: SECRET is undefined
* *RESULT*: SECRET=BAR
fields.summary: Pipeline specific environment variables per branch (Branch variables)

fields.description:
Hello,

SSH multiplexing with bitbucket was disabled and causes many problems - especially in case you use multiple repositories at once (this is for example problem when you do android AOSP development and use repo and gerrit - both of them are often performing operations on many repos at the same time. For repo, it is not a big problem - just a warning message. For gerrit, it is a huge problem as replication fails permanently when SSH multiplexing cannot be established. There are some nasty workarounds in place,

The change happened in July and it is plaguing us till today (we are using some workarounds after we found the reason but It would be much better if it is solved by enabling mulitplexing back - because the workarounds put unnecessary pressure on your infrastructure - for example now we have a job that mirrors about 100 repositories to bitbucket every 10 minutes and that would not be necessary at all if ssh multiplexing is working.

More details can be found in https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/39449158/answers/43549761/comments/43550008

And I was redirected from https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/11/BBS-42335 to create the issue.

Let me copy some parts of this that are relevant:

"Up until a couple of days ago (I guess before the LFS beta was available), I was able to repo sync my android tree with bitbucket, and had no issues replicating with gerrit to bitbucket. Ever since that change, I get this error when repo syncing:\\
channel 2: open failed: administratively prohibited: cannot open additional channels\\
mux_client_request_session: session request failed: Session open refused by peer\\
And something very similar with gerrit replication. I tried temporarily switching my repos to another git server provider, and as I expected everything is ok. Any info on this? Thanks."

Aug 12:\\
"I struggled with this for a while but had no time to take a closer look. Now I know what happens and I have a workaround.\\
The problem is that Bitbucket disabled capability of multiplexing for SSH connections. In short: multiplexing works in the way that you only connect to the same server once. All the other connections are executed as additional channels opened via the single master connection already opened. Git automatically runs ssh commands in multiplexing mode under the hood. You can see that if you run the following while repo sync is running:\\
ps -eaf | grep ssh\\
You will see something similar to:

{code}
#!text

ssh -o ControlMaster=no -o ControlPath=some_path_here .....
{code}

Unfortunately you cannot use .ssh/config (because -o parameters override it).\\
UPDATE: See below answer - apparently you can have ControlMaster set to yes in .ssh and it works fine\\
The solution that I found was to change default SSH command that GIT uses and disable multiplexing altogether. You can set GIT_SSH_COMMAND as follows:

{code}
#!text

export GIT_SSH_COMMAND="ssh -o ControlPath=none"

{code}

Once you do it - git will use your ssh command instead of the default and it will open new SSH connection for every git command separately. It's a bit slower than when multiplexing works but when Bitbucket rejects multiplexed channels, repo sync is even slower (by default ssh will fall-back to non-multiplexing connection when the multiplexing fails so it still works despite the error messages - but much slower).\\
Add it to your .bashrc or similar and you should be good to go.\\
One drawback of this solution is that it is a global setting - all your git via ssh will stop using multiplexing. "

Oct 19:\\
Update: It seems also that works (and it localised to Bitbucket only - so it's better solution):\\
In your .ssh/config add ControlMaster yes for bitbucket:\\
Host bitbucket.org\\
ControlMaster yes\\
Michael Bayer -> we also had problem with replication. Some repos from Gerrit failed to replicate to Bitbucket (especially when there were branches or deleted changes). I know it's a lame solution but we solved it in a simple way. Additionally to built-in Gerrit replication we also run a crontab job every 10 minutes to mirror our repos to Bitbucket - so most of the changes are replicated almost immediately by Gerrit, but those that fail are later re-synced using the external mirroring...\\
Here is the script that we use:

{code}
#!bash

#!/bin/bash
date
pushd /mnt/gerrit/git
SKIPPED_REPOS="(All-Projects.git|All-Users.git)"
for repo in *
do
echo
if [[ $repo =~ ^$SKIPPED_REPOS$ ]]; then
echo "Skipping mirroring $repo"
continue
fi
if [ ! -d "$repo" ]; then
echo "Skipping non-directory $repo"
continue
fi
pushd $repo >/dev/null
REPO_URL=git@bitbucket.org:someprefix/$repo
echo "Mirroring $repo to $REPO_URL"
git push --mirror $REPO_URL 2>&1
popd >/dev/null
done
popd
date

{code}

It mirrors a bit more than the default gerrit replication (includes gerrit config as well for the repo) - but it's still OK.\\
It also increases traffic for Bitbucket quite significantly. I wonder if the latest SSH outages are connected to the fact that some people like us are generating lot more traffic for Atlassian than is needed because we are workarounding some not-well-thought changes on their side.\\
Hey Atlassian !!! - Hear us out please. Enable the SSH mulitplexing back. It will save you ton of traffic and infrastructure to handle it.
fields.summary: Please enable SSH multiplexing back

fields.description:
When trying to clone a Git LFS repo with the Bitbucket LFS Media adapter configured, if the OS temp dir is located on a different drive than the final download location, the clone fails with an _invalid cross-device_ link error

Temporary Workaround: Set TMPDIR to a location on the same drive with the repo location.
fields.summary: Bitbucket LFS Media adapter fails if the temp folder is in a different file system

fields.description: In a very active git environment, it would be nice to set a delay or throttle on the pipelines triggers to be able to delay X minutes before triggering a pipeline. This way if multiple people are committing code, we don't run a build every commit, rather we just run one build, with all commits, after the X minute delay.
fields.summary: Allow user to configure a delay before starting a build (throttle)

fields.description:
May I know if there is a way to display all branches/repository pipeline build in one single page? Or is there API that help to achieve that.

What I wanted was a reporting methodology for all of my builds/projects in a single page.
fields.summary: Pipeline Dashboard

fields.description:
I am trying to write a script to provision developer virtual machines with their BitBucket account. The idea is to generate an SSH key on the VM, then attach this key to their account using the OAuth flow, since I need OAuth access anyway to create repositories.

So what I desire is a single form of authentication which can be used to enable the following:

* Creation of new repositories
* Cloning of repositories using the {{git clone git@...}} command provided by the clone buttons on the BitBucket UI

So my request is to either provide an OAuth scope which allows it to add SSH keys, or make (a subset of) the API available through SSH. I'd prefer the latter, but that seems less likely to happen.

My problem is that I now need to prompt the user to:

# Go through the OAuth flow
# Add a generated SSH key to their account manually

I'd like to reduce this to one step instead of two, which used to be possible with the v1 API. However authenticating with username/password for the v1 API is no longer possible for users who have enabled 2 factor authentication, and I'd rather not store passwords at all.

An alternative would be to enable app passwords for users who do not have 2 factor auth enabled. This could also lead to a consistent experience.
fields.summary: Cannot add SSH key using OAuth

fields.description:
On a mercurial repo, on the Repository Details, there is a link to 'View Details' for next to the Git LFS usage detail:

!2540510252-Screen%20Shot%202016-10-25%20at%204.41.02%20PM.png|thumbnail!

If a user clicks the link, the page will lead to an error 500 page -- which is expected since Git LFS isn't supported on a HG repo. The 'View details' link should not appear on the settings UI at all.
fields.summary: Customer Report: A Mercurial Repo should not show the link to 'View Details' for Git LFS on the repo settings

fields.description:
I love pipelines, great work Atlassian!

Would be great though if you could add support for git submodules - had to jump through quite a few hoops to make them work in my setup.
fields.summary: Feature request: support for submodules in pipelines

fields.description:
It would be nice if we can see the approval status of a pull request's author, similar to how we can see the "aui-avatar-badged" icon for the reviews. See attachment for an example:

!3356370552-Screen%20Shot%202016-10-24%20at%206.54.30%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add Pull Request Author Status Icon

fields.description: Per [API v2 Docs|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/search%3Fq%3Dtag:refs] it looks like there is only GET support for tags. Any reason? This would be incredibly useful to be able to POST a new tag via API from a continuous deploy system (like Octopus) after a push to production.
fields.summary: POST new tag via API

fields.description:
Hello,

This morning I received two emails regarding this project: https://bitbucket.org/axis41/fcdc which I'm not a part of and had never looked at until today. The notifications were sent because I was added as a reviewer on two different pull requests. I'm sure this was in error, as I have no idea what this is, but I'd like to rid my account of the association because it shows up in my "Pull Requests" list. I've unwatched the pull requests but they're still waiting for review and the project is still listed in my "Projects" list. How can I get rid of these items please?
fields.summary: Marked as reviewer for pull requests on a project I'm not a part of.

fields.description:
One of the most useful features of Bitbucket Server is the "Diff" tab on pull requests.  It allows reviewers to look file-by-file at each change and make comments so the PR author can fix them.

The Bitbucket Cloud product already shows the Diff tab when a PR is created, but this is only useful to the PR author.  To be effective in team environments, contributors also need to be able to review and comment on changes on a file-by-file basis.

I contacted Atlassian support and was told that at the end of each PR is a "files changed" section that shows the changes.  Reviewing pages and pages of inline diffs is cumbersome at best, and at worse it is simply broken (see attached photo).

Since the Diff tab already exists for PR submission, it should be trivial to add it to the PR review screen. The utility of this functionality cannot be overstated.

Please enable this feature in Bitbucket Cloud.

I'm filing this as blocking because Bitbucket Cloud implementation is actually broken for large PR's.

!3961702609-bitbucket_cloud_pr.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Bitbucket Cloud needs "Diff" tab on pull requests.

fields.description:
Previously if a PR had conflicts, we showed a warning icon next to the merge button but you could still click Merge and get some additional instructions.

With the changes in the merge-restrictions feature, a user no longer has access to these instructions. Instead, upon clicking the merge button, they see an inline dialog with the reasons the PR can't be merged, but no command line instructions.

It would be nice to have these instructions back
fields.summary: Bring back merge instructions for PRs with conflicts

fields.description:
Running Safari on Mavericks.

BUG 1:

I noticed that lately, the code button doesn't seem to work in certain circumstances, which I have worked out to be:

# When text in the text area takes up more lines than are visible
# Then the page is not scrolled to the bottom

If both of those cases are true, the code button does not insert the code wrapping tags and scrolls the page to the bottom.

Bug 2:

Clicking cancel when asked what type of code tags to insert, inserts the tags anyway.

I have created a screen recording of these behaviors:

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/87939936/BUGS/bb-code-button-bugs.mov
fields.summary: Clicking the "<>" code button while composing comment on an issue scrolls the page and does not insert code tags

fields.description:
As a .NET developer and big fan of Atlassian i want to migrate my CI processes (TeamCity on Windows instance in AWS cloud) to Bitbucket Pipelines.

Features that many .NET devs (who use Bitbucket) would like to have:

# Build windows apps (asp.net mvc5, .NET 4.6 apps).
# Use Bitbucket Pipelines as a CI server and don't host any TeamCity instances...
# Add a private nuget feed that will contain latest versions of our internal packages (like nuget feed plugin for TeamCity) as a .NET developers we use our own nuget repository for company packages.
fields.summary: Support for native Windows/.NET builds on Pipelines

When I add a README.md with markdown formatting, that one is displayed correctly.\\
Running Bitbucket v4.10.0, problem started after upgrade from Stash.
fields.summary: README.rst not being displayed on repo homepage

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While trying to approve a PR using REST API with "Reset approvals when the source branch of a pull request is modified" is enabled on Branch Permission, the PR's approval UI is not updated.

!3599808308-ApproveUI.gif|thumbnail!

###Steps to Reproduce

# Create Branch Permission with the below option checked:

* Require at least (1) approval
* Reset approvals when the source branch of a pull request is modified

# Create a pull request
# Use Bitbucket API to Approve PR

{code}
#!bash
curl -iX POST -u "$user:$Password" 'https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/<User>/<Repo>/pullrequests/<PRNumber>/approve
{code}

# Refresh the PR page -- approval is not displayed
# Uncheck the "Reset approvals when the....." in the branch permission
# Refresh the PR page -- approval is displayed

###Expected Results\\
PR approval UI is updated after the Bitbucket API request is send

###Actual Results\\
Curl output shows the PR is already approved, but there're no changes on PR UI
fields.summary: PR's approval UI is not properly updated via REST API while using "Reset approvals" feature

fields.description:
We are using Shippable where we pull from repositories from bitbucket. Not sure if the issue is with Shippable or Bitbucket.

Yesterday on our submodule fetching stopped working, it had been working correctly prior to this. I have double checked that the deployment key from Shippable is set and is right for the submodule repository.

**Fetching submodule flib\\
Warning: Permanently added the RSA host key for IP address '104.192.143.1' to the list of known hosts.\\
conq: repository access denied. deployment key is not associated with the requested repository.\\
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights\\
and the repository exists.\\
**
fields.summary: Private submodule fetching stopped working
Branches are not listed on the "Branches" page if there is no 'master' branch in the repo

fields.description: Pre the new branch restriction UI, you would get a full branch list in the entry dropdown field by simply clicking the box.  Now, you have to physically start typing to get matching patterns to your branches.
fields.summary: Change behavior of branch restriction entry box to populate branches in dropdown without having to type. (end user request)

fields.description:
My team recently started using BitBucket to host our source code and really like the server-side merge functionality included in pull requests. Unfortunately, this occasionally results in multiple heads being created on the destination branch after the merge. Most Mercurial usage patterns expect that a named branch only has a single head, to make it clear where the most up-to-date development is happening.

It would be fine if Bitbucket rejected the request and had the user bring the branch up to date first, but simply allowing the multiple heads is incorrect behavior by most Mercurial standards.

This is similar to BCLOUD-4334.
fields.summary: Pull Request Merge can result in multiple heads

fields.description: It would be nice if there were some simple filters that could apply to the issue exporter, like "exclude attachments larger than this size", "include only issues with status OPEN or NEW", etc. This would be helpful in case the export zip is to big to download.
fields.summary: Ability to exclude files by size before issue exports create the zip file

fields.description:
On the Commit page that shows the commit history it should be showing the account that pushed up the commit set.  The user that is currently displayed is the e-mail in the ~/.gitconfig which provides no security or accurate measure of who "actually" triggered the commit.  A user could easily push a malicious commit appearing as someone else and if it was not caught in the activity feed the historical information of who actually made the change would be lost.  Currently the information on who pushed a commit or set of commits up is only shown in the activity feed which in an active team is lost very quickly.

This is less than ideal and the perception of most companies is the commit page is showing users who authenticated to push the change set(s).  Upon finding out it was simply the ~/.gitconfig e-mail I was greatly concerned.  I consider this to be a bug, what is the point of security and auditing if it is completely meaningless and can be maliciously spoofed?
fields.summary: Commits should show account that executed the push

fields.description:
This isn't as trivial as I'd like it to be since we'd have to check the manifest of each push for {{.hgtags}} and then do a union merge across all open heads 😱

I'm marking this as a feature request since it will require some thinking on how to implement.
fields.summary: webhooks: add mercurial tag info

fields.description: When you try import the SSH Key from github automatically, the system seems don't check if exist a Key, and we get an error, if i remember right was like 'Error, Can't import SSH Keys from Github', I think it should check if exist some Key, and if is the case send the correct error message.
fields.summary: Improve SSH Key error messages from WebInterface

fields.description: Currently there seems to be no way to start a pipeline build manually. You can restart old builds, but if pipelines has been disabled you need to push to the repository in order to start a new build from HEAD.
fields.summary: Support for manually starting a pipeline job

fields.description: In some cases, it is not possible to add back a U2F key that was previously used, and then completely removed.
fields.summary: A U2F key that was previously removed cannot be added back in. (BBCDEV-3134)

fields.description:
Team,

Last Saturday we faced the issue of "No space left on device". Today we are unable to push or pull any changes because of ssh authentication error.

GIT_CURL_VERBOSE=1 git pull\\
Connection closed by 104.192.143.2\\
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

This is happening for all the developers. We are really regretting that we choose bitbucket over github. Please resolve this issue at the utmost priority. Our release are getting affected because of this.
fields.summary: Unable to push or pull in bitbucket

fields.description:
My 100 developers are waiting for that.\\
We are loosing developer's man hour
fields.summary: Unable: git push origin master

fields.description:
I am unable to push a commit.

Counting objects: 15, done.\\
Delta compression using up to 8 threads.\\
Compressing objects: 100% (8/8), done.\\
Writing objects: 100% (8/8), 1.13 KiB | 0 bytes/s, done.\\
Total 8 (delta 5), reused 0 (delta 0)\\
error: RPC failed; result=52, HTTP code = 0\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly\\
Everything up-to-date
fields.summary: Unable: git push origin master

fields.description:
git push/pull is extremely slow via SSH

ssh_exchange_identification: Connection closed by remote host fatal: Could not read from remote repository.\\
Please make sure you have the correct access rights and the repository exists.

This is the error I get, but I have access to the repo
fields.summary: git push/pull is extremely slow via SSH

fields.description: I change private repository name and I think links to the project must be changed too. But links from "Recent activity" block became broken. After page reload still broken.
fields.summary: After rename repository links became are broken.
